events.eventText:
You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You rummage through the supplies and take whatever seems useful.

Draw a supply card. You gain 1 medpac. Claim this token.

You drop down from your shuttle outside the base and are immediately met with blaster fire. Shyla curses under her breath, "It was a trap; they knew we were coming."

Your pilot comes in on your comlink: "It seems this is a little hotter than we were expecting. I should be able to scramble the doors and get you guys in soon, but you'll have to hold your own for a while. Light em up, Shyla."

{-} Deploy the heroes to the blue highlighted space.
{-} Doors are locked.
{-} The mission will progress at the end of Round 2.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

eventActions.theText:
{-} Doors are locked.
{-} The mission will progress at the end of Round 2.
{-} The Rebels lose when all heroes are wounded.

events.eventText:
“We're clear; pull us out!” Shyla calls through her comlink. You sprint out of the base and climb into the shuttle amidst blaster fire. As you catch your breath, you see Shyla sit down in the corner, continuing to read and reread the recovered datapads.

{-} The Rebels win the mission!
{-} Shyla Varad receives the “Mandalorian Heritage” Reward card.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

“Shyla, it's a lost cause; get out!” your pilot pleads over your comlink. You grab Shyla and force her to retreat into the shuttle. As you fly away, she sees the Imperials bomb whats left of the base, destroying any hope she had left of discovering her past.

{-} The Rebels lose the mission.
{-} Each hero receives 1 XP. Heroes receive 100 credits per hero.

In the data, you find some information on the Death Watch. The Death Watch — or Kyr'tsad in Mando'a — was a Mandalorian splinter group that opposed the Supercommando Codex developed by Mandalorian leader Jaster Mereel. While the Supercommando Codex was supposed to turn the Mandalorians into honorable mercenaries, the Death Watch saw honor only in strength in combat, by any means necessary.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

eventActions.tbText:
The Imperial forces move in, trying to protect the data stores.

{-} The two highest-cost Imperial figures that are not on or adjacent to a data store move 2 toward the closest data store.
{-} The highest-cost Imperial figure becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

events.eventText: In the data, you find some information on the Death Watch. The Death Watch aimed to return to the ways of the old Mandalorians, to raid and wage war in the galaxy. Their opponents, led by Jaster Mereel, called themselves the True Mandalorians. Bitter civil war broke out between the two groups.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

{-} The highest-cost Imperial figure becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

events.eventText: In the data, you find some information on the Death Watch. The Death Watch lost the civil war against the True Mandalorians and were long thought disbanded. In truth, they went into hiding and operated under the principle of ba'slan shev'la, or "strategic disappearance".

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

eventActions.tbText:
The Imperial forces move in, trying to protect the data stores.

{-} The two highest-cost Imperial figures that are not on or adjacent to a data store move 2 toward the closest data store.
{-} The highest-cost Imperial figure becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

events.eventText: In the data, you find some information on Shyla's background. During the Clone Wars, a warrior named Oryus Varad, who - judging from his age - could be Shyla's father, was one of the instructors of the Grand Army of the Republic, training the clone troopers in strategy and combat.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

eventActions.tbText: Alarms blare, and more soldiers rush in to stop you.

events.eventText: In the data, you find some information on Shyla's background. The warrior Oryus Varad apparently perished near the end of the Clone Wars. Data suggests that he was battling his own wife, Ashala.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

eventActions.tbText: Alarms blare, and more soldiers rush in to stop you.

events.eventText:
Sifting through the data and records, Shyla finally finds what she was looking for: her mother’s name, Ashala Varad, listed in the records of the members of the Deathwatch. What Shyla has always hoped was her birthright is now confirmed.

{-} Shyla Varad becomes <color="red">Focused</color>.

translatedEntityProperties.theText:
The data store might hold more information about the Death Watch.

{-} If there are no Imperial figures on or adjacent to a data store, a hero may spend 2 movement points while on or adjacent to that data store to study it.

events.eventText:
"Got it!", your pilot calls over your comlink. "Doors should open in 3... 2... 1..."

The doors slide open to reveal the interior of the base.

translatedEntityProperties.theText: The door into the Imperial base is locked tight.
The door into the Imperial base is locked tight.
The door into the Imperial base is locked tight.

eventActions.repositionText: Be on or adjacent to the closest data store with no Imperial figures on or adjacent to it.

eventActions.tbText:
As the door opens, you find yourselves face to face with an intimidating blaster cannon.

{-} Deploy an E-Web Engineer to the yellow highlighted spaces.
Nearby, stormtroopers and other soldiers raise their weapons, ready to defend the base.
Data stores are placed throughout the base.

events.eventText:
You have gathered all the data available. Time for a daring escape.

{-} Survive until the end of the Round.
